fields.name: requestId
fields.doc: Request id provided by client for correlation and duplicate request check purposes

fields.name: lenderReference
fields.doc: The number by which the Lender identifies a loan facility

fields.name: customerId
fields.doc: Customer Identifier assigned by Genworth. Genworth internal use only

fields.name: funderId
fields.doc: Funder Identifier assigned by Genworth. When an account will be setup for API Genworth will allocate the Funder Id which then will be passed by the customer through the API at each proposal submission

fields.name: originatorId
fields.doc: Originator Identifier assigned by Genworth. An originator is a party or company that originates the loan with the borrower, and will have some control or delegation over the underwriting process provided by the lending customer. An originator will generally not deal directly with Genworth unless granted direct originator status

fields.name: insuredPartyId
fields.doc: The Trustee of the funding program. This is only applicable where the loan is funded by a Trustee. When the insured is not the same as the funder, e.g. a trustee of a funding program, the identifier for the trustee should be provided in this field

fields.name: loanSourceChannel
fields.doc: The source through which the loan application was received. Retail - borrower interacting with a branch/lender mobile banker for home loan application. Third party - borrower interacting with a broker for home loan application. Wholesale - borrower interacting with a mortgage manager or via lender white label program for home loan application. Virtual - borrower interacting with a lender non face-to-face e.g online, digital or call centre for home loan application

fields.name: lenderLoanApprovalDate
fields.doc: Date when the loan was approved by the lender, in ISO 8601 date format, for example 2018-11-11. Applicable to DUA underwriting type

fields.name: loanSettlementDate
fields.doc: The date on which the funds were available to be drawn down by the borrower, in ISO 8601 date format. Applicable to DUA underwriting type

fields.name: preAllocatedLmiPolicyNumber
fields.doc: The LMI policy number that the customer has selected from pre-allocated number ranges. Applicable to DUA underwriting type and to customers that have pre-allocated number ranges

fields.name: topUp
fields.doc: For Top-up on an existing LMI policy, set the field to true. Absence of the field indicates the request is for a new LMI policy

fields.name: otherInsurerDetails
outstandingLoanBalanceInsured
fields.doc: For Top-Ups to a loan previously insured by a different insurer, the topUp field must be False. The outstanding loan balance must be supplied in Outstanding Balance Uninsured field while the additional loan must be supplied in the LoanAmount field. This field is required when doing Top-Ups to a loan previously insured by a different insurer. minimum: 1, maximum: 999999999

fields.name: lmiPremiumPaidDate
fields.doc: For top ups to a loan insured by a different insurer, this is the date when the loan was settled by the lender. This field is required when doing Top-Ups to a loan previously insured by a different insurer.

fields.name: existingPremiumPaid
fields.doc: For Top-Ups to a loan previously insured by a different insurer, this is the existing premium paid. This field is required when doing Top-Ups to a loan previously insured by a different insurer.

fields.name: previousInsuredLoanAmount
fields.doc: The principal balance of the loan, assuming the borrower made the minimum required payments each time they were due (i.e. the loan is not in arrears or ahead of schedule). All loan splits/facilities should be included in this balance. Exclude internally refinanced loan amount that is to be included in the Loans section. The amount can be calculated by summing up current loan balances and all available redraw amounts. Applicable to only top up deals that were previously insured by a company other than Genworth.
Details of the other insurer. This section is to be populated for topups to a loan previously insured by a different insurer.

fields.name: preInforceVariation
fields.doc: Request to update the proposal data that was submitted to Genworth earlier. The proposal must be in one of the pre In Force statuses: Approved, Conditionally Approved, Declined

fields.name: preInforceLmiPolicyNumber
fields.doc: When requesting to update the proposal data previous sent to Genworth, provide the LMI policy number that has been assigned to that proposal. Mandatory when preInforceVariation is true

fields.name: brokerName
fields.doc: Full name of the broker

fields.name: productName
fields.doc: Genworth product name. Standard is available for a wide range of borrowers, including First Home Buyers and investors wishing to access residential mortgage finance. HomeBuyerPlus is available for borrowers, including First Home Buyers, wishing to purchase an owner-occupied property with limited or no savings, or those wishing to use money not sourced from their own savings as a deposit. BusinessSelect is available for Self-Employed borrowers who are unable to produce current financial information or documentation. FamilyPledge is available for borrowers, especially First Home Buyers with no deposit, who have an immediate family member that is willing and able to offer security

fields.name: coverType
fields.doc: The type of insurance cover offered by a policy. FullCover covers 100% of the loan. Top Cover, or First Loss, is where Genworth pays the first portion of a claim up to a maximum amount (determined by cover rate). Risk Share is where Genworth shares the claim amount payable in accordance with the cover rate

fields.name: coverRate
fields.doc: The portion of the insured loan amount that Genworth is at risk for, in percentage, e.g. 80 for 80%. Not required if coverType = FullCover

fields.name: coverTerm
fields.doc: The term of insurance cover in number of years. Only required if the request is for a Limited Term Cover policy

fields.name: lvrCutOff
fields.doc: This is a REQUIRED field for all customers with a valid Monthly Premium Master Policy having multiple LVR cut off. The same field will be IGNORED for customers without multiple LVR cut off.

fields.name: premiumPayment
fields.doc: This is a REQUIRED field for all customers with a valid Monthly Premium Master Policy. The same field will be IGNORED for non-Monthly Premium customers.

fields.name: underwritingType
fields.doc: The LMI underwriting type. Either DUA (delegated underwriting authority) with which the lender underwrites the LMI policy on behalf of Genworth, or STD (Standard) where Genworth will underwrite the policy

fields.name: premiumToBeCapitalised
fields.doc: Indicate whether the premium will be capitalised

fields.name: scheduledLoanBalance
fields.doc: The principal balance of the loan, assuming the borrower made the minimum required payments each time they were due (i.e. the loan is not in arrears or ahead of schedule). All loan splits/facilities should be included in this balance. Exclude internally refinanced loan amount that is to be included in the Loans section. The amount can be calculated by summing up current loan balances and all available redraw amounts. Applicable to Top-up only

fields.name: premiumQuoteNumber
fields.doc: The quotation number provided to a Lender by Genworth to uniquely identify a set of circumstances that led to a premium amount calculation where applicable

fields.name: lendersApplicationRiskScore
fields.doc: The application risk score generated by the lender scoring models

fields.name: existingLmiPolicyNumber
fields.doc: Genworth LMI policy number associated with an existing loan facility with common borrowers and securities. Applicable to Top-up and internal refinance only. To correctly associate a Top-up request with a pre-existing LMI policy, the existing and most recent active Genworth LMI policy number should be supplied at the time of Top-up submission. If existing policy number is unknown, the service will try to find an existing policy based on borrowers and security addresses

fields.name: manualReviewRequired
fields.doc: Indicate if this request requires manual review by an underwriter

fields.name: staffDiscountApplicable
fields.doc: Indicate whether the request is eligeable for a staff discount

fields.name: applicants
applicantType
fields.doc: Entity type of the borrowing party. Use Company for Trust and SMSF

fields.name: applicantRole
fields.doc: Determines whether the applicant is a Borrower or Guarantor

fields.name: individual
firstHomeBuyer
fields.doc: First home buyers are defined as persons entering the home ownership market as owner occupiers or investors for the first time regardless of whether they receive a grant or not

fields.name: firstName
fields.doc: The first name of the individual

fields.name: middleName
fields.doc: The full middle name of the individual

fields.name: surname
fields.doc: The full surname name of the individual

fields.name: dateOfBirth
fields.doc: The date of birth of the individual, e.g. 1999-09-21

fields.name: maritalStatus
fields.doc: The marital status of the individual

fields.name: driversLicenseNumber
fields.doc: Driver licence number of the individual

fields.name: permanentResident
fields.doc: Indicates whether the borrower is a permanent resident of Australia or not (true/false). Note: New Zealand citizens living and working in Australia are considered Permanent Residents. Australian citizens living and working overseas are treated as non-residents for loan purpose

fields.name: currentEmploymentStatus
fields.doc: The current employment status of the individual (Borrower/Guarantor) at time of origination. For LMI purposes, an individual is considered Self Employed when they receive the majority (i.e. 50% or more) of their total income from a business in which they are the sole trader, a partner, director or shareholder

fields.name: employmentBasis
fields.doc: Individuals (Borrower/Guarantor) current employment basis at the time of origination

fields.name: industryType
fields.doc: The industry in which the applicant is working

fields.name: residentialAddress
unitNumber
fields.doc: Unit number. If unit number has not been assigned for a new development, supply the lot number with Lot prefix, e.g. Lot3

fields.name: streetNumber
fields.doc: Street number. If the street number exceeds 8 characters and contains a dash, e.g. 1234-1236, supply the part before the dash only, i.e. 1234. If street number has not been assigned for a new development, supply the lot number with Lot prefix and a space, e.g. Lot 3

fields.name: streetType
fields.doc: Street type. Refer to Genworth street type list

fields.name: country
fields.doc: Country code per ISO-3166 definition. The service accepts only AU in this field.
Street address of applicant or security
Provide details of each individual applicant on a proposal request

fields.name: company
companyName
fields.doc: The registered company name when the borrower/guarantor is a business or company

fields.name: companyType
fields.doc: The registered applicant (borrower/guarantor) company type when the applicant is a business or company

fields.name: companyABN
fields.doc: The applicants Australian Business Number (ABN). This is only required if the applicant (borrower/guarantor) is a business or company

fields.name: companyAddress
unitNumber
fields.doc: Unit number. If unit number has not been assigned for a new development, supply the lot number with Lot prefix, e.g. Lot3

fields.name: streetNumber
fields.doc: Street number. If the street number exceeds 8 characters and contains a dash, e.g. 1234-1236, supply the part before the dash only, i.e. 1234. If street number has not been assigned for a new development, supply the lot number with Lot prefix and a space, e.g. Lot 3
Street address of applicant or security
Details for a Company Borrower

fields.name: annualGrossIncome
fields.doc: The total gross annual income for each applicant (borrower/guarantor) - as used by the lender in their serviceability assessment. The amount is excluding rental income

fields.name: annualGrossRentalIncome
fields.doc: The total gross annual income, where the source is rental income, for each applicant (borrower/guarantor) as used by the lender in their serviceability assessment

fields.name: primaryBorrower
fields.doc: Indicate whether this is the primary borrower in the application. There should be one and only one primary borrower

fields.name: creditScore
fields.doc: This is a REQUIRED field for all customers with a valid Credit Score Pricing Master Policy. The same field will be IGNORED for non-Credit Score Pricing customers.
All applicants (borrowers and guarantors) of the loans

fields.name: lendersServiceabilityType
fields.doc: Serviceability type used by the lender. NDI (net disposable income ratio), NDS (net monthly surplus), DSR (debt servicing ratio)

fields.name: lendersServiceabilityNdiRatio
fields.doc: Serviceability indicator expressed as a ratio of borrowers net disposable income over debt repayments and living expenses. Provide this if serviceability type is NDI

fields.name: lendersNetMonthlySurplus
fields.doc: Provide this if serviceability type is NDS

fields.name: lendersDebtServicingRatio
fields.doc: Provide this if serviceability type is DSR

fields.name: totalSecuredLiabilitiesAmount
fields.doc: Total limit of all secured liabilities (actual balance plus any available redraw) for all applicants at the application date, excluding any liabilities being refinanced as part of the insured loan

fields.name: totalUnsecuredLiabilitiesAmount
fields.doc: Total limit of all unsecured liabilities (actual balance plus any available redraw) for all applicants at the application date, excluding any liabilities being refinanced as part of the insured loan

fields.name: totalMonthlyRepaymentAmount
fields.doc: Total monthly repayment amount for all applicants (borrower/guarantor) commitments as used by the lender in their serviceability assessment, excluding the repayment amount for this loan

fields.name: actualAnnualLivingCost
fields.doc: This is the sum of all applicants (borrower/guarantor) annual living expenses as declared at the time of application. This is inclusive of basic costs and discretionary expenses. Please use the Annual Living Expenses as used in servicing calculator

fields.name: securities
securityType
fields.doc: The type of security. Use CL for commercial properties, IN for industrial properties, OT for Rural properties. For residential properties, use one of the following codes: CA (Inner city apartment), UN (Unit/Flat/Apartment), HO (House/Semi/Townhouse/Duplex/Villa/Terrace), CO (Converted Commercial/Motel/Industrial/Warehouse properties), SM (ServicedApartment/ResortUnit/RentalGuarantee/Timeshare), VM (VacantLand-Major locations), VO (VacantLand-Other locations), SA (Studio apartment/Bedsitter), GU (Limited guarantee-Unit for Family Pledge), GH (Limited guarantee-House for Family Pledge), OT (All others)

fields.name: occupancyType
fields.doc: The borrowers intended purpose of the security at time of origination. Use Investment for rental property

fields.name: securityAddress
unitNumber
fields.doc: Unit number. If unit number has not been assigned for a new development, supply the lot number with Lot prefix, e.g. Lot3

fields.name: streetNumber
fields.doc: Street number. If the street number exceeds 8 characters and contains a dash, e.g. 1234-1236, supply the part before the dash only, i.e. 1234. If street number has not been assigned for a new development, supply the lot number with Lot prefix and a space, e.g. Lot 3

fields.name: streetType
fields.doc: Street type. Refer to Genworth street type list

fields.name: country
fields.doc: Country code per ISO-3166 definition. The service accepts only AU in this field
Street address of applicant or security

fields.name: securityTypeStatus
fields.doc: Status of construction of a security at time of origination. CH (Construction - H&L Package), CX (Constuction - Off the Plan/Other), CO (Construction - Owner Builder), CS (Construction - Standard Building Contract), N (New), E (Establised), V (Vacant Land)

fields.name: estimatedValue
fields.doc: Estimated value of the property in case valuation amount is not available. This is applicable to security type statuses Established or Vacant Land. Please provide either estimatedValue or purchasePrice

fields.name: purchasePrice
fields.doc: The contract sale price of the security excluding stamp duty. Do not supply this field if the loan is a construction loan

fields.name: projectCosts
fields.doc: For a construction loan, the security project cost is the total cost of the land, building costs and costs based on tender price. Security Project Costs is a requirement for construction loans only

fields.name: guaranteeAmount
fields.doc: Limited guarantee amount from the security. Required for family pledge and security type is either GU or GH

fields.name: guarantorExistingLoanAmount
fields.doc: Scheduled loan balance of guarantor attributable to the security. Required for family pledge and security type is either GU or GH

fields.name: valuationPlatform
fields.doc: The name of the valuation platform or the valuation provider that provided the valuation

fields.name: valuationId
fields.doc: The most recent unique valuation identifier as captured by the Lender. For example, Valex Id

fields.name: valuationAmount
fields.doc: The actual valuation amount of the security at the time of Origination

fields.name: contractOfSaleDate
fields.doc: Contract Of Sale Date is the date when applicant signed the property contract

fields.name: valuationDetails
valuationType
fields.doc: string The type of valuation performed on the security

fields.name: valuerCompanyName
fields.doc: The company name of the valuation firm that performed the valuation of the security

fields.name: valuationDate
fields.doc: The actual valuation date of the security, in RFC-3339 format

fields.name: valuerFirstName
fields.doc: First Name of the individual valuer that conducted the valuation

fields.name: valuerSurname
fields.doc: Surname of the individual valuer that conducted the valuation

fields.name: livingAreaInSqm
fields.doc: Total size of the living area in square metres, excluding balcony and car accommodation. Applicable to houses and units

fields.name: siteArea
fields.doc: Total land size. Applicable to houses and vacant land

fields.name: siteAreaUnitOfMeasurement
fields.doc: Unit of measurement for the site area

fields.name: noOfBedrooms
fields.doc: Total number of bedrooms in the property

fields.name: currentUse
fields.doc: The current use of the property

fields.name: marketability
fields.doc: Marketability indicator as appearing in the Property Summary section of the valuation report

fields.name: sellingPeriodGreaterThanSixMonths
fields.doc: Selling period greater than 6 months indicator as appearing in the Sales Evidence and The Market section of the valuation report

fields.name: commentsForSellingPeriod
fields.doc: Detailed comments on selling period greater than 6 months

fields.name: essentialRepairsRequired
fields.doc: Essential repairs indicator as appearing in the Property Summary section of the valuation report

fields.name: essentialRepairDetails
fields.doc: Essential repair comments as appearing in the valuation report

fields.name: internalCondition
fields.doc: Internal condition indicator as appearing in the Main Building section of the valuation report

fields.name: externalCondition
fields.doc: External condition indicator as appearing in the Main Building section of the valuation report

fields.name: weeklyRentalValueUnfurnished
fields.doc: Weekly Rental Value Unfurnished as estimated by the valuer in the valuation report

fields.name: propertyAndMarketRiskRatings
locationAndNeighbourhood
fields.doc: The ratings provided by the valuer on the API Property Pro Forma report

fields.name: land
fields.doc: The ratings provided by the valuer on the API Property Pro Forma report

fields.name: environmentalIssues
fields.doc: The ratings provided by the valuer on the API Property Pro Forma report

fields.name: improvements
fields.doc: The ratings provided by the valuer on the API Property Pro Forma report

fields.name: marketVolatality
fields.doc: The ratings provided by the valuer on the API Property Pro Forma report

fields.name: recentMarketDirection
fields.doc: The ratings provided by the valuer on the API Property Pro Forma report

fields.name: localEconomyImpact
fields.doc: The ratings provided by the valuer on the API Property Pro Forma report

fields.name: marketSegmentConditions
fields.doc: The ratings provided by the valuer on the API Property Pro Forma report
Risk Rating of Property and Market

fields.name: comparableSales
saleAdddress
unitNumber
fields.doc: Unit number. If unit number has not been assigned for a new development, supply the lot number with Lot prefix, e.g. Lot3

fields.name: streetType
fields.doc: Street type. Refer to Genworth street type list

fields.name: country
fields.doc: Country code per ISO-3166 definition. The service accepts only AU in this field
Street address of applicant or security

fields.name: saleDate
fields.doc: The date that the comparable property was sold, in RFC-3339 format

fields.name: salePrice
fields.doc: The selling price of the comparable property
Comparable Sales information

fields.name: custForecastStandardDeviation
fields.doc: Forecast Standard Deviation also known as a confidence score, is the value included within a AVM valuation type which is the deviation of a valuation value

The valuation details object to capture the attributes of a valuation report. This object is not required if the valuation platform is VaLex and there is an arrangement between the funder and Genworth to obtain the valuation report from VaLex directly
All securities (properties) for the loans

fields.name: loans
lenderLoanAccountId
fields.doc: The ID by which the Lender identifies each loan split within a loan facility. A single loan facility can have multiple Lender Loan split IDs as this field is unique to each Loan Component (split)

fields.name: loanTermInMonths
fields.doc: The agreed contracted term of the loan at the time of origination. In the event of a Top-up or variation to the policy, that impacts loan term, the new loan term must be provided

fields.name: loanType
fields.doc: The type of the loan. Indicate whether the loan is a regular mortgage loan or line of credit (LOC), and for the purchase of an investment property or an owner occupied property. PC (Owner Occupied), PI (Investment), LC (Owner Occupied - LOC), LI (Investment - LOC)

fields.name: loanRepaymentType
fields.doc: The type of payment features the loan has at the time of origination. PIF (Fixed P&I), PIV (Variable P&I), IOC (I/O Conversion to P&I), IOF (Interest Only Fixed), IOV (Interest Only Variable)

fields.name: loanAmount
fields.doc: The maximum approved amount of credit that is available for each loan component at the time of origination excluding the capitalised premium amount

fields.name: loanPurpose
fields.doc: The predominant purpose of this loan component. Where there are two or more purposes that are of equal amount, the purpose should be selected in line with the following prescribed hierarchical order: REF(Refinance), DCO(Debt Consolidation), ERL(Equity Release/Cash Out), CFD(Controlled Funds), BRG(Bridging), PCH(Purchase/Buy Real Estate), BCN(Construction/Build), HIM(Home Improvements), IRF(Internal Refinance)

fields.name: initialInterestRateType
fields.doc: The customer contracted mortgage interest rate type applicable to the loan at time of origination

fields.name: fixedRatePeriodInMonths
fields.doc: The number of months from the settlement date that the interest rate on the loan component is fixed

fields.name: interestOnlyPeriodInMonths
fields.doc: The period after which a non amortising loan (i.e. Loan Repayment Type = Interest Only) reverts to an amortizing loan. This is the period that is calculated from the loan settlement date
The Loan Details used to capture the attributes of a loan

fields.name: contactName
fields.doc: Name of the customers staff member that submitted/requires a response for the proposal

fields.name: contactPhone
fields.doc: Contact phone number of the customers staff member. Include area code for land line numbers

fields.name: contactEmail
fields.doc: Email address of the customers staff member

fields.name: additionalNotes
fields.doc: The free text notes that the lender has entered in to their system to support the approval of the loan application

fields.name: campaign
fields.doc: Campaign is an additional field to be used when pre-agreed with Genworth
